data.title: cityonfire.com
data.text:
Chad Stahelski – co-director of the original John Wick and sole director for John Wick: Chapter 2 and John Wick: Chapter 3 – Parabellum – is attached to direct an adaptation of Sucker Punch Productions’ action adventure game Ghost of Tsushima for Sony Pictures and PlayStation Productions. Game’s official premise: It’s the late 13th century, and the Mongol empire has laid waste to entire nations in its campaign to conquer the East. Tsushima Island is all that … Continue reading →

Jackie Chan will be one of the stars to appear in All U Need is Love, an action comedy from Vincent Kok (Keep Calm and Be a Superstar), who directed Jackie Chan over 20 years ago in 1999’s Gorgeous. According to AFS, All U Need is Love is a benefit film for industry workers impoverished by the Covid-19 crisis. It’s just one of the many films – along with Andrew Lau’s … Continue reading →

Filmmaker Park Hoon-jung (The Witch: Part 1. The Subversion, Tiger: An Old Hunter’s Tale) returns to The New World territory with Night in Paradise (read our review), an upcoming crime-thriller starring Um Tae-goo (The Age of Shadows) that hits Netflix on April 9th. Directed and written by Park Hoon-jung, while less than 10 years ago Hoon-jung’s calling card was being known as the man who wrote the scripts for I Saw the Devil and … Continue reading →

Personal injuries—which include slip and fall, burns, medical malpractices, etc.—can hit your life hard. To some, it will mean the end of making an income. These injuries can also render you immobile. However, you can file for compensation and revert back to normal life. Hiring a good lawyer will make things easier for you. However, you should choose the right Houston Personal Injury Lawyer. Start with a free consultation. With … Continue reading →

However, you can find the right casino suitable for you depending on some factors. Some of these are reliability, online reputation, customer support, and much more. Likewise, one can get most of these advantages of online gambling … Continue reading →

From director Daniel Zirilli (The Asian Connection) comes Hollow Point, an upcoming actioner starring Luke Goss (Cartels). When his wife and daughter are senselessly murdered, a grieving man (Goss) finds himself caught up in a war between a group of charismatic vigilantes and the crime that infests their city. Hollow Point also features an all-star cast that includes Juju Chan (Savage Dog), Jay Mohr (Jerry Maguire), Michael Pare (The Debt Collector), Bill Duke (Predator) … Continue reading →

Valiant Entertainment’s Jason Kothari (Bloodshot) has acquired rights to Bruce Lee’s original screenplay for The Silent Flute, which will be adapted into a special limited series by writer John Fusco (Marco Polo, Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon: Sword of Destiny). “As a lifelong martial artist and practitioner of Bruce Lee’s Jeet Kune Do, the chance to help bring his personal opus to life is an honor and privilege. What Bruce wrote, along with … Continue reading →

Keanu Reeves (John Wick 1, 2 and 3) is set to star in and produce BRZRKR, a Netflix’ live-action film adaptation of his BOOM! Studios-published comic book of the same name. The film will be followed by an anime spinoff series. BRZRKR is about an immortal warrior’s 80,000-year fight through the ages. The man known only as “B” is half-mortal and half-god, cursed and compelled to violence… even at the sacrifice of … Continue reading →

On March 23, 2021, Vinegar Syndrome will be releasing the Blu-ray for Death Promise (aka Slumfighter), a 1977 cult actioner starring Charles Bonet (Way of the Black Dragon), Speedy Leacock and Bill Louie (Fist of Fear, Touch of Death). Check out the official details below: The residents of a dilapidated New York tenement building are being harassed and threatened by Iguana Realty, the dummy corporation which owns the land, in … Continue reading →

Today’s Deal on Fire is the Blu-ray Jean-Claude Van Damme’s 2019 thriller We Die Young. The film comes from Acclaimed filmmaker Lior Geller (known for his short film Roads, which holds the Guinness World Record for Most Awards Won by a Short Student Film). In We Die Young, Lucas (Elijah Rodriguez, Sicario 2: Soldado), a 14-year-old boy inducted into the gang life in Washington D.C., is determined that his 10-year-old brother won’t follow the same path. … Continue reading →

There are nearly 35.4 million American users online dating every year. With so many people looking for love in the same place, it’s not hard to blend into the crowd. Potential partners may be talking to one or more suitors at a time. If you make it to the stage of seeing each other in person, you need to find a way to stand out. Up-and-coming filmmaking trio Lai Siu Kwan, Lau Wing Tai and Sze Pak Lam – who all shared directing credits for 2019’s Guilt by Design – are teaming up again for a bank heist thriller called Under Control. Under Control will star Louis Koo (Accident, The Legend of Zu), Jessica Hester Hsuan (Masked Prosecutor, A Witness Out of the Blue), Louis Cheung (The Trough) and Philip Keung (Master Z: Ip Man … Continue reading →

Movies have become part of our culture, influencing how we dress, live, or travel. It also impacts our thoughts and opinions. When it comes to gambling, movies brilliantly showcase the thrill and intense feeling of casino games like poker and roulette. In the 60s and 70s, the James Bond movies portrayed casinos as the hotspot for the rich and powerful. This mindset about gambling as a rich people’s game changed … Continue reading →
